DOCTRAIN.TITLE: Debian project
DOCTRAIN.BODY: In rolling, trunk rotation and elbow support were difficult for the most severely diplegic children. In 2 patients, carotid angiography demonstrated segmental narrowing and occlusion of the middle cerebral artery. Part I of this paper describes some of the pathophysiological events leading to ischaemic brain injury. Cardiac autonomic function was measured in 25 subjects with insulin-dependent diabetes mellitus and 11 control subjects. Molecular analysis of this abnormality demonstrated a deletion within the fifth intron of the c-sis gene. Men who reported pain in the preceding year were more likely to use multiple analgesic products. We present our experience in the surgical management of 25 consecutive patients treated for these problems. We conclude that topographic mapping is a valid technique in the detection of localized cerebral lesions. The highest incidence of remote neuromuscular disorders in cancer has previously been reported in lung carcinoma. Blacks and Japanese have more intracranial occlusive cerebrovascular disease, while whites have more extracranial disease. Forty-six percent of the patients had a more or less pronounced tilt of the pituitary stalk. Adult male Sprague-Dawley rats underwent spinal cord trauma at the midthoracic level using a weight-dropping technique. We present the case of an 18-year-old woman with intractable complex partial seizures since age 13. A 64-year-old man presented with the acute onset of unilateral blindness and ipsilateral ocular motor paresis. Two patients had had ischemic strokes 5 months and 18 years, respectively, before transplantation. A qualitative assessment of edema was made from light and electron micrographs of the cerebral cortex. A case is presented of a child with trauma to the vertebrobasilar artery resulting in stroke. uring the 10-minute apnea tests, nine patients were given continuous apneic oxygenation by tracheal cannula.
